sen.j: 志苔館（しのりたて）は、北海道函館市に所在する中世城館跡。
sen.e: Shinoridate Castle is the ruin of a Medieval castle in Hakodate City, Hokkaido.
Shinoridate Castle is the ruin of a Medieval castle in Hakodate City, Hokkaido.
Shinoridate Castle is the ruin of a Medieval castle in Hakodate City, Hokkaido.

sen.j: 小林氏によって築かれたとされる道南十二館のひとつ。
sen.e: It is one of Donan-juni mansions that were said to be established by the Kobayashi clan.
It is one of the Donan Juni Kan (12 castles of the Oshima Peninsula) that are thought to have been established by the Kobayashi clan.
sen.cmt: ・「the」を追加・「were said to be」→「are thought to have been」
sen.e: It is one of the Donan Juni Kan (12 castles of the Oshima Peninsula) that are thought to have been established by the Kobayashi clan.

sen.j: 国の史跡に指定されている。
sen.e: It is designated as a national historic site.
It is designated as a national historic site.
It is designated as a national historic site.

sen.j: 西には旧志苔川があり、東は溪沢に連なっており、南方は海に面した丘陵上に立地する。
sen.e: In the western direction the old Shinori-gawa river runs, in the eastern direcion the site is continuous with valleys, and in the sourhern direction it is located on hills facing the sea.
sen.cmt: 旧志苔川の読み方が分かりませんでした。
sen.e: It stands on a hill with the old Shinori-gawa River to the west, valleys and dales to the east and the sea to the south.
sen.cmt: 原文を反映するように再翻訳
sen.e: It stands on a hill with the old Shinori-gawa River to the west, valleys and dales to the east and the sea to the south.

sen.j: 1983年から1985年にかけて函館市教育委員会によって発掘調査が行われた。
sen.e: An excavation and research was conducted by Hakodate City Board of Education from 1983 to 1985.
Excavations were conducted by the Hakodate City Board of Education from 1983 to 1985.
sen.cmt: ・「Excavation and research was」→「Excavations were」・「An」を削除・「the」を追加
sen.e: Excavations were conducted by the Hakodate City Board of Education from 1983 to 1985.

sen.j: 館跡は、自然地形を活かし、四方に土塁と薬研（やげん）または箱薬研状の空堀が巡らされている。
sen.e: The ruin is surrounded by earthen walls and dry moats shaped as yagen (a tool used to grind Chinese medicine) or box yagen, taking advantage of its natural terrain.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処 箱薬研の読み方、英訳がわかりませんでした。
sen.e: The ruins take advantage of the natural terrain, surrounded by earthen walls and a dry moat shaped like a yagen mortar or box yagen mortar.
sen.cmt: ・「ruin is」→「ruins are」・「dry moats」→「a dry moat」・「as yagen (a tool used to grind Chinese medicine) or box yagen」→「like a yagen mortar or box yagen mortar」・再構成
sen.e: The ruins take advantage of the natural terrain, surrounded by earthen walls and a dry moat shaped like a yagen mortar or box yagen mortar.

sen.j: 全体でほぼ長方形の形状を呈している。
sen.e: As a whole, it has a rectangle shape.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: As a whole, it has a rectangle shape.
As a whole, it has a rectangle shape.

sen.j: 内部は東西約70-80メートル、南北約50-65メートルで、約4,100平方メートルの広さがある。
sen.e: Inside of the site, it is about 70 to 80 meters in the east-west direction and about 50-65 meters in the south-north direction, and the site has about 4,100 square meters.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The interior measures approximately 70-80m from east to west, and approximately 50-65m from north to south, with a surface area of approximately 4,100 square meters.
sen.cmt: 原文を反映するように再翻訳
sen.e: The interior measures approximately 70-80m from east to west, and approximately 50-65m from north to south, with a surface area of approximately 4,100 square meters.

sen.j: 曲輪の内部では掘立柱建物跡や井戸が確認されている。
sen.e: Inside Kuruwa (walls of a castle), ruins of buildings with hottate bashira (earthfast post) and wells are found.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The remains of buildings with hottatebashira (earthfast posts) and wells have been found within the kuruwa (castle walls).
sen.cmt: ・再構成・「post」→「posts」・「walls of a castle」→「castle walls」・「ruins」→「remains」・「are found」→「have been found」
sen.e: The remains of buildings with hottatebashira (earthfast posts) and wells have been found within the kuruwa (castle walls).

sen.j: 土塁の高さは、北側で約4.0-4.5メートル、南側で約1.0-1.5メートルである。
sen.e: The earthern walls were about 4.0 to 4.5 meters high in the northern side and about 1.0 to 1.5 meters high in the southern side.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The earthen walls are about 4.0 to 4.5 meters high in the northern side and about 1.0 to 1.5 meters high in the southern side.
The earthen walls are about 4.0 to 4.5 meters high in the northern side and about 1.0 to 1.5 meters high in the southern side.

sen.j: 土塁の外側にあたる北側と西側には幅約5-10メートルの空堀が設けられ、最も深い所で約3.5メートルの深さをもつ。
sen.e: In the norther and western sides, which were outside the earthern walls, there were dry moats, whose deepest part was about 3.5 meters deep.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In the northern and western sides, which are outside of the earthen walls, there is a dry moat that is approximately 3.5m deep at its deepest point.
sen.cmt: ・「norther」→「northern」・「were」→「are」・「of」を追加・「earthern」→「earthen」・「there were dry moats, whose deepest part was about 3.5 meters deep.」→「there is a dry moat that is approximately 3.5m deep at its deepest point」
sen.e: In the northern and western sides, which are outside of the earthen walls, there is a dry moat that is approximately 3.5m deep at its deepest point.

sen.j: 発掘調査では、15世紀前半ごろを主体とする青磁・白磁・珠洲焼・越前焼・古瀬戸様式などの陶磁器が出土している。
sen.e: During the excavation and research, ceramic ware, pottery and chinaware, including celadon, white porcelain, Suzu-yaki Pottery, Echizen-yaki Pottery, Koseto style pottery, which were mainly made in the former fiftheenth century, were discovered.

Excavations have unearthed ceramics and porcelain including celadon porcelain, white porcelain, Suzu-yaki pottery, Echizen-yaki pottery and Koseto style pottery which mainly date from the first half of the 15th century.
sen.cmt: 原文を反映するように再翻訳
sen.e: Excavations have unearthed ceramics and porcelain including celadon porcelain, white porcelain, Suzu-yaki pottery, Echizen-yaki pottery and Koseto style pottery which mainly date from the first half of the 15th century.

sen.j: これらの遺物の年代は『新羅之記録』に記された長禄元年のコシャマインの戦いにおける志苔館陥落の時期（1457年）と矛盾しない。
sen.e: The date of these findings are consistent with the date of the fall of Shinoridate Castle (1457) in Battle of Koshamain in the same year, which was recorded in "Shiragi Record."
sen.cmt: 『新羅之記録』の英訳が見つかりませんでした。
sen.e: The ages of these artefacts are consistent with the date of the fall of Shinoridate Castle (1457) in the Battle of Koshamain of the same year recorded in "Shinra no Kiroku".
sen.cmt: ・「date」→「ages」・「findings」→「artefacts」・「the」を補足・「in」→「of」・「, which was recorded in "Shiragi Record."」→「as recorded in "Shinra no Kiroku"」
sen.e: The ages of these artefacts are consistent with the date of the fall of Shinoridate Castle (1457) in the Battle of Koshamain of the same year recorded in "Shinra no Kiroku".

sen.j: 1934年（昭和9年）8月9日、国の史跡に指定された。
sen.e: The site was designated as a national historic site on August 9, 1934.
The site was designated as a national historic site on August 9, 1934.
The site was designated as a national historic site on August 9, 1934.

sen.j: 腰曲輪、濠、溪沢全体に指定地が及ぶようにするため、1971年（昭和46年）5月に追加指定がなされている。
sen.e: In May 1971, koshiguruwa (the compound bounded by earthworks), moat, and valleys were additionaly designated as a national historic site.
In May 1971, the koshiguruwa (compound bounded by earthen walls), the moat, valleys and dales were additionally designated as a national historic site.
sen.cmt: ・「the」を２つ追加・「the」を１つ削除・「earthworks」→「earthen walls」・「and valleys]→「valleys and dales」・「additionaly」→「additionally」
sen.e: In May 1971, the koshiguruwa (compound bounded by earthen walls), the moat, valleys and dales were additionally designated as a national historic site.

tit.e: The excavation of a large amount of Chinese coins
The Excavation of a Large Number of Chinese Coins
The Excavation of a Large Number of Chinese Coins

sen.j: 1968年、志苔館の南西方向100メートル地点から、埋納されたと推定される越前焼、珠洲焼の大甕3個が出土した。
sen.e: In 1968, from 100 meters in the southwestern direction from the ruin, they discovered big jars of Echizen-yaki or Suzu-yaki Pottery, which were thought to have been buried.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In 1968, three large Echizen-yaki and Suzu-yaki jars which are assumed to have been buried were excavated at a site 100m southwest of Shinoridate Castle.
sen.cmt: 原文を反映するように再翻訳（翻訳漏れも修正）
sen.e: In 1968, three large Echizen-yaki and Suzu-yaki jars which are assumed to have been buried were excavated at a site 100m southwest of Shinoridate Castle.

sen.j: その中より計37万枚におよぶ、主として中国の銅銭が出土している。
sen.e: About 370,000 coins, most of which were Chinese copper coins, were found in the jars.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: About 370,000 coins, most of which were Chinese copper coins, were found in the jars.
About 370,000 coins, most of which were Chinese copper coins, were found in the jars.

sen.j: 「北海道志海苔中世遺構出土銭」として国の重要文化財（考古資料）に指定され、市立函館博物館に所蔵されている。
sen.e: They are named 'excavated coins from Shinoridate Castle ruin in the medieval age in Hokkaido' and designated as Important cultural properties (archaeological materials) and reserved in Hakodate Municipal Museum.
sen.cmt: 「北海道志海苔中世遺構出土銭」の英訳が見つかりませんでした。
sen.e: They were nationally designated an Important Cultural Property as "Hokkaido Shinori Chusei Iko Shutsudosen" (lit. Coins Excavated from Medieval Remains in Shinori, Hokkaido), and are deposited at Hakodate Municipal Museum.
sen.cmt: 原文を反映するように再翻訳
sen.e: They were nationally designated an Important Cultural Property as "Hokkaido Shinori Chusei Iko Shutsudosen" (lit. Coins Excavated from Medieval Remains in Shinori, Hokkaido), and are deposited at Hakodate Municipal Museum.
